Issues.Title: NPE In Unmanaged Code When Pressing Keys In TreeView
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

.Net 8.0

### Did it work in .NET Framework?

Yes

### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

My project started in .Net Framework 4.x. I eventually migrated to .Net Core 3.1, then 5.0, 6.0, 7.0 and finally 8.0.
I can't remember exactly when this issue started but it might've been with .net core 3.1.

### Issue description

I have a TreeView control. I also have various keyboard shortcuts which are handled by a MenuStrip.
I've discovered that randomly when I'm using the arrow keys to move around inside the TreeView control, I will get an exception that doesn't contain any user code at all so I'm unable to handle it.
I've found the exact error spot in the source code and even made my own fork that handles the error graceful with one simple line change.
It appears to be attempting to send a ToolTip to the form despite me not having any ToolTips.

Error line in source: https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/blob/release/8.0/src/System.Windows.Forms/src/System/Windows/Forms/ToolTip.cs#L1576
In the source it is calling `tool.GetOwnerWindow()` however this returns a null value and the code seems to be expecting a non-null value.

### Steps to reproduce

I've been unable to reproduce this error in a brand new project. It only occurs on my mature project that originally started out in .Net Framework 4.x.
![Net Issue](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/18266662/20a5fef7-21d5-45aa-b1f8-640afecf3259)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "NPE In Unmanaged Code When Pressing Keys In TreeView" (#11083)

Issues.Title: Re-add Conditionals for PR YAMLs
Issues.Body:
PR YAMLs will get used in internal projects, so add back related conditionals that were removed in https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/11025
 ###### Microsoft Reviewers: [Open in CodeFlow](https://microsoft.github.io/open-pr/?codeflow=https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/11082)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Re-add Conditionals for PR YAMLs" (#11082)

Issues.Title: Enable more analyzers
Issues.Body:
Enable another batch of analyzers.

Make a pass cleaning up DesignerHost based on feedback from earlier PRs. (Modern patterns, duplicated docs not needed, etc.)

 ###### Microsoft Reviewers: [Open in CodeFlow](https://microsoft.github.io/open-pr/?codeflow=https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/11081)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Enable more analyzers" (#11081)

Issues.Title: Enable more code analyzers
Issues.Body:
Enable a number of additional code analyzers. One of the more impactful ones here is that we don't want to throw "runtime" exceptions or Exception itself. Changed a number of `Exception` instances to `InvalidOperationException`.

 ###### Microsoft Reviewers: [Open in CodeFlow](https://microsoft.github.io/open-pr/?codeflow=https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/11073)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Enable more code analyzers" (#11073)

Issues.Title: Notifyicon and Windows 11 issues using System.Data.Oledb(8.0.0) library
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

Net 6.0

### Did it work in .NET Framework?

Yes

### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

_No response_

### Issue description

In Windows 11, when I query an Access database using the System.Data.Oledb library (v.8.0.0) the application name and icon are no longer displayed correctly in the notifyicon as per the attached screenshot. The same program, run in Windows 10 does not give the same problem.
![Notify Icon](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/13166825/95deb604-b42f-47af-9ff8-be80d81f5980)


### Steps to reproduce

[WinFormsApp1.zip](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/files/14649217/WinFormsApp1.zip)
Compile and start the attached project and clicking on Show notify
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Notifyicon and Windows 11 issues using System.Data.Oledb(8.0.0) library" (#11078)

Issues.Title: Remove TraceSwitch from CodeDomSerializer
Issues.Body:
Tracing predates debugger trace points, which accomplish what we typically need to do when debugging.

Not having the tracing makes it easier to read the code, as well as easier to make complexity-reducing automated changes (inverting blocks, returning early, etc.).

Some of the affected code here is currently indented over 10 levels deep.
 ###### Microsoft Reviewers: [Open in CodeFlow](https://microsoft.github.io/open-pr/?codeflow=https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/11062)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Remove TraceSwitch from CodeDomSerializer" (#11062)

Issues.Title: Form's forecolor overwrite DataGridView cell's forecolor
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

.NET 9.0.100-preview.3.24165.20

### Did it work in .NET Framework?

No

### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

No, It also reproduce on .NET 6.0.

### Issue description

The DataGridView cell's forecolor should be fore color setting in DataGridView defaultcellstyle, not form's forecolor.

### Steps to reproduce

1. Create Winform .NET Core project.
2. Set Form's forecolor as red.
3. Add DataGridView.
4. Click Add Column… in DataGridView Tasks to add a DataGridViewTextBoxColumn.
5. Set DataGridView DefaultCellStyle's forecolor to Lime.
6. Build and run app.
7. Input text and observe test color.

https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/130345015/3ed54d2f-0638-4a57-9dfc-b8fab69e78b3
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Form's forecolor overwrite DataGridView cell's forecolor" (#11065)

Issues.Title: Remove finalization watch from System.Drawing
Issues.Body:
Removing code that does not compile as part of our normal builds.

In the future we can add debug code in the finalizer methods that will fail when the finalizer is hit (as we do with the scopes for HDC, etc.). Keeping an initialization stack isn't super useful.

Note that the try catch blocks are not needed as with direct interop we shouldn't see exceptions that we would handle.
 ###### Microsoft Reviewers: [Open in CodeFlow](https://microsoft.github.io/open-pr/?codeflow=https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/11061)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Remove finalization watch from System.Drawing" (#11061)

Issues.Title: WinForms Repo Readme update
Issues.Body:
We got some very good and important feedback on the summit, and this is a first step (and draft) to get that feedback addressed in a quick way.

Please read and comment.

Thanks!
 ###### Microsoft Reviewers: [Open in CodeFlow](https://microsoft.github.io/open-pr/?codeflow=https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/11060)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "WinForms Repo Readme update" (#11060)

Issues.Title: Remove unused code
Issues.Body:
This enables a number of additional analyzers. The key one is turning unused code into warnings. Ends up we had quite a bit of unused parameters and fields.

I've tried to err on the side of caution when properties or methods might be used in the designer.

This also enforces using switch expressions when possible.

Other enablements (that didn't change much):

- Use keywords for types (int over System.Int) is now a warning
- Use null propagation is  now a warning
- Precompiled regex is now an error
- No protected members in sealed types
- Suppression format checks
 ###### Microsoft Reviewers: [Open in CodeFlow](https://microsoft.github.io/open-pr/?codeflow=https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/11057)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Remove unused code" (#11057)

Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Re-enable CS0618" (#11054)

Issues.Title: Update editorConfig with preferred C#/VB setting 1/3
Issues.Body:
This is a Draft that separates 3 preferences for VB from C# in .editorConfig

## Proposed changes

Separate 3 options where C# wants true:silent and I propose VB wants false:Suguestion
dotnet_style_coalesce_expression
dotnet_style_prefer_conditional_expression_over_assignment
dotnet_style_prefer_conditional_expression_over_return

Also VB only add
dotnet_separate_import_directive_groups = false:warning ' need to verify syntax

## Customer Impact
None this is just to establish Visual Basic specific style for Repo agreed upon by team working on VB

## Regression? 
- None, its to improve consistancy and easy of reading VB code by none VB Programmers.

## Risk
- None, it may just product some extra suguestions that I will fix in a follow on PR. 

## Test methodology <!-- How did you ensure quality? -->
No code changes

 ###### Microsoft Reviewers: [Open in CodeFlow](https://microsoft.github.io/open-pr/?codeflow=https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/11056)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Update editorConfig with preferred C#/VB setting 1/3" (#11056)
